Folks,
Just wanted to let you know about an add-on, called sct-cantera, we
=
wrote for Cantera in MATLAB. It is available on sourceforge
http://sourcefo=
rge.net/projects/sct-cantera/

sct-Cantera was written specifically to enab=
le keeping track of
multiple thermodynamic states. In the original Cantera =
package, a gas
mixture is represented by a large programming object in the =
computer's
memory. In order to compare thermodynamic properties between sta=
tes, a
programmer had two choices: (1) create multiple gas objects (a time
=
and resource intensive process) or (2) continually update a single
"gas obj=
ect," but extract all relevant thermodynamic properties from
each state and=
 store them in separate variables. To enable more
efficient and readable co=
de, we programmed a set of wrapper functions
into the sct-Cantera package.
=

sct-Cantera does add some more functionality.  For example, the MATLAB
Can=
tera interface is unable to set some combinations of thermodynamic
properti=
es but sct-cantera allows this. For example, with sct-Cantera
the user can =
simultaneously set Temperature and Entropy. 

The zip file on sourceforge h=
as been tested with Cantera 1.6

We welcome thoughts and comments.

Rebecca=
 Hunt
Stanford University
